Package socialmedia

Class SocialMedia

java.lang.Object
socialmedia.SocialMedia
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, MiniSocialMediaPlatform, SocialMediaPlatform
public class SocialMedia
extends java.lang.Object
implements SocialMediaPlatform
Main class for this social media app that implements most of the SocialMediaPlatform interface's methods.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Hayden, Jorel
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Account> accounts  
    (package private) GenericPost genPost  
    (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Post> posts  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    SocialMedia()
    Instantiates a social media platform object that stores accounts, posts and a generic post which holds all comments that originally pointed to posts that have since been deleted.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void appendChildrenRecursively​(Post post, java.lang.StringBuilder sb, int depth, boolean firstComment)
    This method recursively generates a StringBuilder containing a thread of comments on a post or comment with distinct indentation for each level by taking the comment/original post as input and going through the comments array, appending each comment and it's children to the StringBuilder.
    void changeAccountHandle​(java.lang.String oldHandle, java.lang.String newHandle)
    The method replaces the oldHandle of an account by the newHandle.
    void checkAccountIdExists​(int id)
    Checks if an account exists with the passed id and throws an exception if not.
    void checkHandleExists​(java.lang.String handle)
    Checks if an account exists with the passed handle and throws an exception if not.
    void checkIllegalHandle​(java.lang.String handle)
    Checks if the passed handle already belongs to an account in the system and throws an exception if it does.
    void checkInvalidHandle​(java.lang.String handle)
    Checks if the passed handle conforms to the following rules for handles in this social media system: must not be empty or have more than 30 characters and must not have white spaces.
    void checkPostExists​(Post post)
    The method checks if the post object passed as input contains info and is not null.
    void checkPostIsActionable​(Post post)
    Checks if the post object passes as input is able to be endorsed and commented on.
    void checkPostIsValid​(java.lang.String message)
    Checks if the passed post message conforms to the following rules for posts in this social media system: must not be empty or contain more than 100 characters.
    int commentPost​(java.lang.String handle, int id, java.lang.String message)
    The method creates a comment post referring to an existing post, similarly to a reply on Twitter.

    The method creates an account in the platform with the given handle.

    The method creates an account in the platform with the given handle and description.
    int createPost​(java.lang.String handle, java.lang.String message)
    The method creates a post for the account identified by the given handle with the following message.
    void deletePost​(int id)
    The method removes the post from the platform.
    int endorsePost​(java.lang.String handle, int id)
    The method creates an endorsement post of an existing post, similar to a retweet on Twitter.
    void erasePlatform()
    Method empties this SocialMediaPlatform of its contents and resets all internal counters.
    Account getAccountByHandle​(java.lang.String handle)
    Returns the account object that matches the specified handle or null if none match it.
    Account getAccountById​(int id)
    Returns the account object that matches the specified id or null if none match it.
    int getMostEndorsedAccount()
    This method identifies and returns the account with the most number of endorsements, a.k.a.
    int getMostEndorsedPost()
    This method identifies and returns the post with the most number of endorsements, a.k.a.
    int getNumberOfAccounts()
    This method returns the current total number of accounts present in the platform.
    int getTotalCommentPosts()
    This method returns the current total number of comments posts present in the platform.
    int getTotalEndorsmentPosts()
    This method returns the current total number of endorsement posts present in the platform.
    int getTotalOriginalPosts()
    This method returns the current total number of original posts (i.e., disregarding endorsements and comments) present in the platform.
    int idGenerator​(java.lang.String option)
    Generates an id which is 1 higher than the existing highest one.
    void loadPlatform​(java.lang.String filename)
    Method should load and replace this SocialMediaPlatform's contents with the serialised contents stored in the file given in the argument.
    int postCount​(java.lang.Class<?> input)
    Counts how many posts there are which are instances of the passed post class in the system.

    Returns the post object associated with the passed id or null if none match it.

    The method removes the account with the corresponding ID from the platform.

    The method removes the account with the corresponding handle from the platform.

    Removes an account from the system along with any of it's posts.
    void removeCommentFromParent​(CommentPost commentPost)
    This method uses the input of comment post and removes it from it's parent post's comment ArrayList.
    void removeEndorsementFromParent​(EndorsementPost endorsementPost)
    This method uses the input of endorsement post and removes it from it's parent post's endorsement ArrayList.
    void savePlatform​(java.lang.String filename)
    Method saves this SocialMediaPlatform's contents into a serialised file, with the filename given in the argument.
    java.lang.String showAccount​(java.lang.String handle)
    The method creates a formatted string summarising the stats of the account identified by the given handle.
    java.lang.String showIndividualPost​(int id)
    The method generates a formated string containing the details of a single post.
    java.lang.StringBuilder showPostChildrenDetails​(int id)
    The method builds a StringBuilder showing the details of the current post and all its children posts.
    void updateAccountDescription​(java.lang.String handle, java.lang.String description)
    The method updates the description of the account with the respective handle.

    • idGenerator

      public int idGenerator​(java.lang.String option)

      Parameters:
      option - option to choose either accounts (a) or posts (p)
      Returns:
      the new id

    • createAccount

      public int createAccount​(java.lang.String handle) throws IllegalHandleException, InvalidHandleException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method creates an account in the platform with the given handle.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Specified by:
      createAccount in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      handle - account's handle.
      Returns:
      the ID of the created account.
      Throws:
      IllegalHandleException - if the handle already exists in the platform.
      InvalidHandleException - if the new handle is empty, has more than 30 characters, or has white spaces.

    • removeAccount

      public void removeAccount​(int id) throws AccountIDNotRecognisedException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method removes the account with the corresponding ID from the platform. When an account is removed, all of their posts and likes should also be removed.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Specified by:
      removeAccount in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the account.
      Throws:
      AccountIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any account in the system.

    • checkInvalidHandle

      public void checkInvalidHandle​(java.lang.String handle) throws InvalidHandleException

      Parameters:
      handle - handle to be checked
      Throws:
      InvalidHandleException - thrown if the handle does not conform to the specified rules

      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method replaces the oldHandle of an account by the newHandle.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Specified by:
      changeAccountHandle in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      oldHandle - account's old handle.
      newHandle - account's new handle.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the old handle does not match to any account in the system.
      IllegalHandleException - if the new handle already exists in the platform.
      InvalidHandleException - if the new handle is empty, has more than 30 characters, or has white spaces.

    • showAccount

      public java.lang.String showAccount​(java.lang.String handle) throws HandleNotRecognisedException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method creates a formatted string summarising the stats of the account identified by the given handle. The template should be: 
       ID: [account ID]
 Handle: [account handle]
 Description: [account description]
 Post count: [total number of posts, including endorsements and replies]
 Endorse count: [sum of endorsements received by each post of this account]
      Specified by:
      showAccount in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      handle - handle to identify the account.
      Returns:
      the account formatted summary.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the handle does not match to any account in the system.

      public int postCount​(java.lang.Class<?> input)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      amount of posts of the specified class in the system

    • endorsePost

      public int endorsePost​(java.lang.String handle, int id) throws HandleNotRecognisedException, PostIDNotRecognisedException, NotActionablePostException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method creates an endorsement post of an existing post, similar to a retweet on Twitter. An endorsement post is a special post. It contains a reference to the endorsed post and its message is formatted as:

      "EP@" + [endorsed account handle] + ": " + [endorsed message]

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Specified by:
      endorsePost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      handle - of the account endorsing a post.
      id - of the post being endorsed.
      Returns:
      the sequential ID of the created post.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the handle does not match to any account in the system.
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.
      NotActionablePostException - if the ID refers to a endorsement post. Endorsement posts are not endorsable. Endorsements are not transitive. For instance, if post A is endorsed by post B, and an account wants to endorse B, in fact, the endorsement must refers to A.

    • checkPostIsActionable

      public void checkPostIsActionable​(Post post) throws NotActionablePostException
      Checks if the post object passes as input is able to be endorsed and commented on. This is not true if it is an endorsement post.
      Parameters:
      post - post object
      Throws:
      NotActionablePostException - thrown if the passed post object is an endorsement post

    • checkPostExists

      public void checkPostExists​(Post post) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
      The method checks if the post object passed as input contains info and is not null.
      Parameters:
      post - - passes post Object.
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - - checks if post is null, if true throws exception

    • commentPost

      public int commentPost​(java.lang.String handle, int id, java.lang.String message) throws HandleNotRecognisedException, PostIDNotRecognisedException, NotActionablePostException, InvalidPostException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method creates a comment post referring to an existing post, similarly to a reply on Twitter. A comment post is a special post. It contains a reference to the post being commented upon.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Specified by:
      commentPost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      handle - of the account commenting a post.
      id - of the post being commented.
      message - the comment post message.
      Returns:
      the sequential ID of the created post.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the handle does not match to any account in the system.
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.
      NotActionablePostException - if the ID refers to a endorsement post. Endorsement posts are not endorsable. Endorsements cannot be commented. For instance, if post A is endorsed by post B, and an account wants to comment B, in fact, the comment must refers to A.
      InvalidPostException - if the comment message is empty or has more than 100 characters.

    • deletePost

      public void deletePost​(int id) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method removes the post from the platform. When a post is removed, all its endorsements should be removed as well. All replies to this post should be updated by replacing the reference to this post by a generic empty post.

      The generic empty post message should be "The original content was removed from the system and is no longer available.". This empty post is just a replacement placeholder for the post which a reply refers to. Empty posts should not be linked to any account and cannot be acted upon, i.e., it cannot be available for endorsements or replies.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Specified by:
      deletePost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      id - ID of post to be removed.
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.

    • removeCommentFromParent

      public void removeCommentFromParent​(CommentPost commentPost)
      This method uses the input of comment post and removes it from it's parent post's comment ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      commentPost - comment post object

    • removeEndorsementFromParent

      public void removeEndorsementFromParent​(EndorsementPost endorsementPost)
      This method uses the input of endorsement post and removes it from it's parent post's endorsement ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      endorsementPost - endorsement post object

    • showIndividualPost

      public java.lang.String showIndividualPost​(int id) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method generates a formated string containing the details of a single post. The format is as follows: 
       ID: [post ID]
 Account: [account handle]
 No. endorsements: [number of endorsements received by the post] | No. comments: [number of comments received by the post]
 [post message]
      Specified by:
      showIndividualPost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      id - of the post to be shown.
      Returns:
      a formatted string containing post's details.
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.

    • showPostChildrenDetails

      public java.lang.StringBuilder showPostChildrenDetails​(int id) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException, NotActionablePostException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      The method builds a StringBuilder showing the details of the current post and all its children posts. The format is as follows: 
       showIndividualPost(id)
 |
 [for reply: replies to the post sorted by ID]
 |  > showIndividualPost(reply)
      See an example: 
       ID: 1
 Account: user1
 No. endorsements: 2 | No. comments: 3
 I like examples.
 |
 | > ID: 3
     Account: user2
     No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 1
     No more than me...
     |
     | > ID: 5
         Account: user1
         No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 1
         I can prove!
         |                                         
         | > ID: 6                                 
             Account: user2                        
             No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 0 
             prove it                    
 | > ID: 4
     Account: user3
     No. endorsements: 4 | No. comments: 0
     Can't you do better than this?
 
 | > ID: 7
     Account: user5
     No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 1
     where is the example?
     |
     | > ID: 10
         Account: user1
         No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 0
         This is the example!
      Continuing with the example, if the method is called for post ID=5 (showIndividualPost(5)), the return would be: 
       ID: 5
 Account: user1
 No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 1
 I can prove!
 |                                         
 | > ID: 6                                 
     Account: user2                        
     No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 0 
     prove it
      Specified by:
      showPostChildrenDetails in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      id - of the post to be shown.
      Returns:
      a formatted StringBuilder containing the details of the post and its children.
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.
      NotActionablePostException - if the ID refers to an endorsement post. Endorsement posts do not have children since they are not endorsable nor commented.

    • appendChildrenRecursively

      public void appendChildrenRecursively​(Post post, java.lang.StringBuilder sb, int depth, boolean firstComment)
      This method recursively generates a StringBuilder containing a thread of comments on a post or comment with distinct indentation for each level by taking the comment/original post as input and going through the comments array, appending each comment and it's children to the StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      post - passes post object
      sb - StringBuilder that the thread is built within
      depth - used to calculate spacing and format comments on posts and comments on comments recursively

    • getNumberOfAccounts

      public int getNumberOfAccounts()
      Description copied from interface: SocialMediaPlatform
      This method returns the current total number of accounts present in the platform. Note, this is NOT the total number of accounts ever created since the current total should discount deletions.
      Specified by:
      getNumberOfAccounts in interface SocialMediaPlatform
      Returns:
      the total number of accounts in the platform.

    • getTotalOriginalPosts

      public int getTotalOriginalPosts()
      Description copied from interface: SocialMediaPlatform

      Specified by:
      getTotalOriginalPosts in interface SocialMediaPlatform
      Returns:
      the total number of original posts in the platform.

      public void loadPlatform​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Description copied from interface: MiniSocialMediaPlatform

      Specified by:
      loadPlatform in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
      Parameters:
      filename - location of the file to be loaded
      Throws:

      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if required class files cannot be found when loading
